full_text: Great meeting today. Strong agreement on the need for high speed rail connections, providing  more balanced regional development on the whole island. https://t.co/B4jLPvgL1j
"The critical thing is the need for a national land use review and a plan." https://t.co/NISt3o1mtE #agriland

Very proud that we are still able to hold our annual convention online this year. Debating the critical issues  facing our country, updating our constitution and teams. In the best tradition of @greenparty_ie. #oursforthemaking https://t.co/1wahiJobW2

I was glad to get Government agreement this week for the heads of our new Climate Change Bill. We are going to swirch from using fossil fuels in a well planned and  collaborative way. That change is going to be really good for our people & for our country. https://t.co/hIbABNc75M
This is great news for Dublin and will start taking shape in spring. These are the routes, with final public consultation to come on the corridors https://t.co/hUnnBrpoc7 via @IrishTimes

Inspiring to meet Joe and the team at the Fairplay cafe in Ringsend, part-powered by the sun. Flying the flag for community energy in all senses of the word, thanks to @SEAI_ie support  https://t.co/0J1Qq8CLiA https://t.co/FkTG4IuE8L

The Fair Play Cafe in Ringsend is one of 39 community projects that have just got a total of €28m funding from @SEAI_ie for clean energy projects. The new solar panels complement the charitable history of the building. We're warming up on this transition. https://t.co/vMt0gJVkjD https://t.co/eZRKLklaw8
"Blowing out someone else's candle won't make yours shine any brighter." @Love1solidarity https://t.co/4g4BsKd5tU

Sobering report on how climate change will affect us. We can't say we don't have the information - what we need to do is act. From @ichec, and funded by @epa using Waterford IT supercomputer https://t.co/cZH5C90qC9

This supports the at least 7% per annum cuts in emissions we have committed to in our own Programme for Government. We look forward to working with the @EU_Commission on the making it happen and powering on from there to deliver fully on the Paris climate agreement. @vonderleyen https://t.co/BjP3EndS2X

I was glad to meet @galwaygreenway Alliance last week. Their proposal would be a game changer for Galway & could include a loop from Moycullen to Barna via Salthill.  It's been talked about for years but now is the time to make it happen. @GalwayCityCo @GalwayCoCo @galwaygreens https://t.co/60ntLnPkGk

Thank you @dlrcc for also supporting surfing lessons for autistic teenagers, which are  organised by https://t.co/uvuqDSbKiT. They take place down the coast at Magheramore beach, close to Brittas Bay.  We are lucky to live so close to paradise. https://t.co/nLGUBZI5HZ

Steady stream of cyclists and pedestrians along DunLaoghaire seafront today. The council has created a first class facility which will transform the area for the better. #greenway @dlrcc @dublincycling https://t.co/ZR9WOPJOz4
Excuse the pun but this is an excellent thread on fast fashion and waste from @carolynmoore_ie https://t.co/iQqbHjOYSM

.@GalwayIntArts have installed a "Mirror Pavillion" work by the artist https://t.co/6BaS2tbL3W down in the Claddagh. Its reflects the history of milling on the Corrib and virtual reality technology allows the whole scene circle in time. https://t.co/XdvvtHt45E #GIAF20 #Galway2020 https://t.co/DCyFwciN83
Going live in the next 5 minutes. https://t.co/J7tszm1j3G

I'd like to thank all the NGO's and others in industry and consumer groups who contributed to the Waste Action Plan. This isn't just a Government, or Green plan - it's everyone's plan, so let's move ahead and implement it together now. https://t.co/IcxnhB3X6o

A deposit & return scheme for plastic bottles and cans, and a ban on some of the worst single use plastics; just a few of the the highlights of our new #WasteActionPlan. It's also a path to a more sustainable future -and makes sound environmental and economic sense. https://t.co/S4Cxrq0iAj
https://t.co/1sKnxn9qgv
Further announcements to come re other parts of the country - NTA covers metropolitan areas only

Full speed ahead - delighted €55m from July Stimulus already allocated to councils for specific projects; cycleways, footpaths, bus shelters, bike parks in Greater Dublin/Cork/Limerick/Galway/Waterford metro areas. Good for jobs communities and environment @TFIupdates @DttasIrl https://t.co/YzZ1xL0P1V
“Stand your ground! Don't move! Don't panic! This is your city! This is your city!”   John Hume lived it. He stood his ground  @GerardHowlin https://t.co/byNBFtTwkH

So sorry to hear of the death of Brendan Halligan. He was a friend and mentor to so many people in politics and public life. A socialist, parliamentarian, businessman internationalist and climate campaigner all in one person. We will miss him dearly.  https://t.co/4PPpsiZjWY
Painfully slow but I am confident we can deliver more in the next 5 years than was built in the last 25. https://t.co/006yyrdKxE
“Stand your ground! Don't move! Don't panic! This is your city! This is your city!”   John Hume lived it. He stood his ground https://t.co/P24rtv24wV
Congratulations Sarah and Jay. https://t.co/ffTC4qSumP
21% of adults don't currently cycle but would like to. Read the 'bike life' report from @TFIupdates here: https://t.co/EumZKnJ9ap https://t.co/eJ18gHDJPb

I'm honoured to have been re-elected leader of @greenparty_ie.  I also have had the privilege of working with @cathmartingreen over the last nine years and look forward to continuing working with her to serve our country and our party to the best of our abilities. https://t.co/bfe18sDHBh
@Ireland_Greener @CorkGreens @HollyCairnsTD Dereen Gardens, halfway out on the Beara Peninsula.

I met @robertburns73 while cycling out to the forty foot this afternoon. He & his team in @dlrcc deserve great credit for pressing ahead with the start of a southside coastal cycle route. It will transform our city in time. Other councils would do well to try the same approach. https://t.co/0hmE4x2P9p
Get the app.  So we can all keep tabs on covid19 https://t.co/uo8r5wlMBg
Cracking maiden speech in Seanad Éireann by @RoisinGarvey from the beautiful West Coast of Clare. https://t.co/NcZ9ErUxhJ
Locks are down.  Mask are on. Stay safe. https://t.co/m3HV6exEav
Good luck Eileen. I think you will be a great addition to Seanad Éireann. https://t.co/IQvzB26iAn
Big congratulations to @hazechu who has been elected as Lord Mayor of Dublin this evening. @greenparty_ie https://t.co/Wr3tuF9RJu
Very proud to see the @greenparty_ie team take their place in Seanad Eireann. @VincentPMartin1 @paulinegalway   @RoisinGarvey @pippa_hackett https://t.co/o3vRJNKSEz

The Programme for Government sets out a strategy to get out country out of the immediate #covid19 economic crisis by investing in public infrastructure and employing people to help tackle the climate and biodiversity crisis.  https://t.co/bJInymtFRR

.@SafetyBeforeLng be rest assured, if we can agree to the #PFG we will implement the policies which will see an end to the importation of fracked gas via any LNG terminals in Ireland.  We've better energy alternatives available & for everyone's sake we need to #keepitintheground. https://t.co/DghUppAqpk

If we can help form a Government next weekend it will be a time to role up our sleeves and get to work for the Irish people. #NowIsTheTime #PFG #GreenNewDeal #Greenpfg https://t.co/uxVdxiFxqs via @newstalkfm
I set out the case for voting yes for @greenparty_ie involvement in Government on @rte earlier today. https://t.co/tgArXB1acu
All my sympathies to @gardainfo and to the Horkan family, as they bury their colleague and son and brother Colm. Ar dheis Dé go raibh a anam dílis. https://t.co/3ydsuUZkCh

I'm asking @greenparty_ie members to vote yes to our entering into Government. We do so to implement an economic stimulus that must help protect the most vulnerable people in our society at the same time as we address the climate and biodiversity crisis. #votegreenpfg #PFG https://t.co/7yhv5DxgBd
Vote yes @greenparty_ie https://t.co/HJnc2m8Wvx

The economic strategy for the next Government should see a large stimulus package for the next 2-3 years, with borrowing for current spending reducing after that but continuing for capital investment in public housing, health, transport & climate action. https://t.co/bTv0fm5ByQ

Within months we must put a recovery fund & new national economic plan in place. The key focus of this government will be to invest in public housing, public health, public transport and climate action. It's the right economic, social & environmental strategy for today. #GPSC2020 https://t.co/JT7wxaZi3y

.@rodericogorman argues a "green new deal" stimulus is at the heart of the economic strategy in the Programme for Government. We will borrow to invest in capital projects & to get people back to work, so we exit from the recession & set ourselves up for a shared future. #GPSC2020 https://t.co/XjLHLdc7gH

"We stepped up, we played senior hurling and we left it all on the pitch."  @MarcKC_Green reviewing his experience on the @greenparty_ie Programme for Government negotiation team. #SharedFuture #GPSC2020 https://t.co/4jyahNtnLR
"The programme for government is by some distance the most environmentally progressive such programme in the history of the State." #SharedFuture @diarmuidtorney https://t.co/h5GDxJ8Pmk
"The Irish campaign demonstrated an empathy with regional issues and the importance of a practical response in support of those most affected by climate change." https://t.co/XDeZztitDQ
Well done to everyone involved in winning a seat on the Security Council. It gives us some influence at a highly uncertain and risky time in our world. #sharedfuture https://t.co/cJYrYK2fgG

"The Programme for Government provides an opportunity which is not likely to be repeated, in terms of transforming Ireland from being a climate laggard into a leader within the EU system. " #SharedFuture https://t.co/1JXNOZWRxo

"The question is can we tackle the climate and biodiversity crisis in a way that creates an economy that is fairer. That is more secure and involves everyone in a really balanced way." #SharedFuture https://t.co/tLlwXjBdWf via @newstalkfm

.@greenparty_ie members. Do me a favour. Check your email. Make sure you register to vote on the draft Programme for Government before 1pm tomorrow, Wednesday 17th June. https://t.co/aPHAKxa1a1 https://t.co/ZJI8MMgzKd

.@greenparty_ie members will have to register to get a ballot paper by 1pm tomorrow Wednesday 17th June.  The message to members is "Check your Email" to make sure you received a link to the registration form and fill it in straight away. #CheckYourMail #RegisterNow #SharedFuture https://t.co/WuhT786p59

I'm proud of how negotiation team got this Programme for Government agreed with @fiannafailparty & @FineGael.  Our Parliamentary Party has also endorsed the deal and it is now up to our members to decide on whether we do enter Government. #sharedfuture https://t.co/uhafIB5Z7h

I made a speech in the Dáil today about the scourge of racism in our society. In quoting from an article I read this morning, I repeated a racial slur, and I was completely wrong to do so. I want to apologise for any hurt caused. I know this particular word should never be used.
@EdibleRice @greenparty_ie @LeoVaradkar I'd have to defer to @BirdsMatter_ie for advice.
